result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke R Faircloth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Completion Letter
from DOC advising that revocation has been withdrawn. Per Court, Please cancel.

10:50 AM Defendant Luke R Faircloth appeared by phone from Wisconsin Resource Center. Attorney Deb Mancoske appeared by phone. Attorney Tara L. Teesch appeared in Court. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews report of Dr. Pankiewicz, questions how to proceed. Atty Mancoske advises that Defendant has to advise whether he believes he is competent. Court questions Defendant on whether he received report. Defendant isn't sure. Court questions Defendant on whether he agrees with finding in report. Defendant agrees. Atty Mancoske requests that hearing be set in three months. Court finds that Defendant has not regained competency.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 11, 2020 at 11:10 am.
John Pankiewicz, M.D.

11:38 AM Attorney Tara L. Teesch in court. Attorney Deb Mancoske appeared by phone. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Karen from the Wisconsin Resource Center appeared by phone, advised that Defendant refused to stay in room, refused to take the call. Court reviews competency report received in November. State proposed that case be set out 90 days from the date of the last report, would expect a new report by that hearing advising if Defendant has regained competency. Atty Teesch advises that Defendant has refused to take her calls both times she has arranged to speak with him, is of the position that his refusal to participate in the process indicates his continued incompetency. Atty Mancoske advises of events in Madison proceeding, including Defendant's position that he is incompetent. Court questions how to proceed, reviews statutes. Atty Teesch responds, waives right to prevent further evidence on competency issue, agrees that Court should make incompetency finding based on report filed. State is not claiming that Defendant is competent, is not intending to present evidence. Court finds right to present testimony has been waived, finds that Defendant is standing mute by refusing to speak with counsel and participate in today's conference call.  Competency hearing scheduled for February 20, 2020 at 10:50 am.

11:31 AM Defendant Luke R Faircloth not in court. Attorney Tara L. Teesch in court. Atty Mancoske appeared by phone. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not been scheduled to appear for hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 3, 2019 at 11:30 am.
Jenna Goebel, Pys.D.; Deborah Collins, Pys.D.

01:22 PM Defendant Luke R Faircloth appeared by phone from Wisconsin Resource Center. Attorney Tara L. Teesch appeared in Court. Attorney Debra Mancoske appeared by phone. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions whether further hearings are needed on competency issue. Atty Teesch responds, believes further hearings will be necessary and that Defendant would have to be transported for that hearing. Atty Mancoske advises that Defendant stated today that he is not competent, that he is at Wisconsin Resource Center to regain competency, Defendant has to state it on the record. Court questions Defendant, who does not feel competent. State/Atty Teesch agree. Court receives Doctor's report. Defendant/Atty Mancoske can appear by phone for next hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for November 25, 2019 at 11:30 am.
Per phone call from Sgt. Lurquin at Dane County Jail, Defendant has been transported to Wisconsin Resource Center.
Phone appearance confirmed for Defendant from Dane County Jail for 9/4 hearing.
Status conference on September 4, 2019 at 01:20 pm.
Craig Schoenecker, M.D.
from Judge Weber to Judge McNamara requesting copy of competency report

Defendant Luke R Faircloth in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Luke R Faircloth in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, prior sentence, receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant, recommendation contained therein. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Court imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-12-2016 11:00 am

Defendant was fingerprinted on 12/2/15.

Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, advises that Defendant is prepared to proceed to plea hearing.
Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Luke R Faircloth in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Luke R Faircloth in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.
Continue to take all medications specifically as prescribed by staff at Mendota Mental Health as to drug, dosage and timing.

Defendant Luke R Faircloth in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer from State, will be prepared to do initial through plea/sentencing tomorrow. Bond set.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
